alert.note: Alert for Burns BLM; Vale BLM (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 02 at 12:16PM PDT until September 03 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...GUSTY WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITIES POSSIBLE ACROSS PORTIONS OF SOUTHEAST OREGON AND SOUTHWEST IDAHO SATURDAY... .An upper low will push into the Pacific Northwest early Saturday morning and then northeastward into the Idaho Panhandle Sunday morning. Strong winds aloft are expected to filter to the surface by late morning bringing strong and gusty winds to the region. The strongest winds lie across Southeastern Oregon and into the West Central Mountains of Idaho. This wind combines with very low afternoon humidity bringing dangerous conditions to the region. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 9 PM MDT SATURDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES FOR WESTERN PAYETTE NATIONAL FOREST...EASTERN PAYETTE NATIONAL FOREST...NORTHERN BOISE NATIONAL FOREST...SOUTHERN BOISE NATIONAL FOREST/WESTERN SAWTOOTH NATIONAL FOREST...OWYHEE MOUNTAINS...BURNS BLM AND VALE BLM...WHICH ARE FIRE WEATHER ZONES 401...402...403...421...423... 636 AND 637... The National Weather Service in Boise has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 10 AM to 9 PM MDT Saturday. * WINDS...15 to 25 mph with gusts 35 to 40 mph. The strongest winds are expected to be over the higher terrain in the West Central Mountains in Idaho. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...5 to 15 percent.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will occur shortly.
